H3381.def: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H6083.def: = the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

H1330.def: = young unmarried woman, who has never been married before, and has never had sex with a man

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H894.def: = town; ◄ in {L:Mesopotamia<SDBH:שִׁנְעָר>}; ► founded by {L:Nimrod<SDBH:נִמְרֹד>}; location of "tower of Babel"; capital of {L:Chaldean<SDBH:כַּשְׂדִּים>} empire

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H3678.def: = large elaborate seat used by people in a position of authority or wealth

H3778.def: exact meaning unknown; = class of persons skilled in magic and soothsaying; ◄ found in {L:Babylon<SDBH:בָּבֶל>}

H3254.def: = action by which humans or deities add to an existing number of entities

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H7390.def: literally: soft of heart; hence: = state in which humans lack courage and decisiveness

H7347.def: = set of two stones ► that are used to grind grain into flour; the grain was placed on the stationary bottom stone, and the top stone was pressed down on top of the grain and scraped back and forth; ≈ associated with hardness

H2912.def: = causative action by which humans reduce objects to tiny particles or powder with the help of a hand-mill or larger millstone; ≈ regarded as a menial task

H7058.def: = flour made from ground grain kernels, ► used for baking bread, as ingredient for food, and as grain offering

H1540.def: = action by which someone takes off his/her clothes, either entirely or in part, ► as a result of which that person becomes naked or improperly dressed, ≈ which is considered a shameful thing to do

H6777.def: = gauze-like covering; ► worn over the face, usually by women; ≈ associated with beauty

H2834.def: = causative action by which humans, deities, or animals remove an object that thinly covers another object

H7640.def: exact meaning unknown, probably: = the part of a coat or dress that hangs below the waist

H7785.def: = the upper part of the leg of humans and animals

H1540.def: = action by which someone takes off his/her clothes, either entirely or in part, ► as a result of which that person becomes naked or improperly dressed, ≈ which is considered a shameful thing to do

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H2781.def: = state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H5359.def: = action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong, and so find relief from their anger

H6293.def: = process by which humans or animals unexpectedly meet other humans or animals while travelling from one location to another

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H6918.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H1748.def: = state in which someone refrains from speaking

H2822.def: = state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H3778.def: exact meaning unknown; = class of persons skilled in magic and soothsaying; ◄ found in {L:Babylon<SDBH:בָּבֶל>}

H3254.def: = action by which humans or deities add to an existing number of entities

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H1404.def: = woman who is in a position of authority over another person as a legal owner, employer, or sovereign

H4467.def: = state in which a person or deity has been entrusted with the office of {L:king<SDBH:מֶלֶךְ>} or {L:queen<SDBH:מַלְכָּה>}

H7107.def: = process by which humans in a position of authority or deities respond with anger to a situation in which (other) humans have disobeyed an order or broken a law

H2490.def: = action by which priests disqualify themselves for religious service ◄ by unlawful behavior

H5159.def: = process by which possessions are transferred from one generation to the next

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H7356.def: = state in which humans feel compassion for others, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well-being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action

H2205.def: = state in which a human being is nearing the end of a long life

H5923.def: = bar or frame ◄ normally made of wood ► used to join two draft animals at the neck so that they can work together effectively in pulling a plow, threshing board, harrow, or wagon; ≈ often used in a figurative sense to denote oppression

H3513.def: = state in which objects have relatively much weight, ≈ which is often associated with slowness, functioning with difficulty, but also with importance, riches, status, etc.

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H1404.def: = woman who is in a position of authority over another person as a legal owner, employer, or sovereign

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H428.def: = marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H319.def: = pertaining to being located far behind other objects in a row, in a direction away from the spectator; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was with their backs facing the East, this term presupposes a westerly direction

H6258.def: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

H5719.def: = process by which humans are occupied with sensuous pleasure

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H983.def: = state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3824.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H490.def: = woman whose husband has died and therefore has difficulty caring for herself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the fatherless, and other people who are poor

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H7908.def: = process by which humans lose one or more of one's offspring; ≈ sometimes associated with loneliness

H428.def: = marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

H8147.def: = state in which a countable entity is two in number

H7281.def: = a very short length of time

H259.def: = state in which a countable entity is one in number

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H7908.def: = process by which humans lose one or more of one's offspring; ≈ sometimes associated with loneliness

H489.def: = state of having lost one's husband; ► required widow's clothing ≈ and was associated with disgrace

H8537.def: literally: completeness; hence: = state in which humans are considered morally blameless, with profound moral uprightness and integrity

H3785.def: = action by which humans make an effort to gain control over humans, animals, or deities ◄ through rituals and incantations

H6109.def: = state in which humans have physical, political, or military strength

H2267.def: = state of being associated with other people for a common purpose

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H1847.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H7837.def: = the first appearance of light in the sky in the early morning

H1943.def: = process by which events take place that cause damage, distress, hurt, and/or loss of life

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H3201.def: mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible

H3722.def: = causative action by which humans cover objects with a coating of a certain substance

H5975.def: = process by which humans, deities, animals, or inanimate objects take position in a certain location in an upright position

H2267.def: = state of being associated with other people for a common purpose

H3785.def: = action by which humans make an effort to gain control over humans, animals, or deities ◄ through rituals and incantations

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H3021.def: = action by which humans are engaged in laborious activity which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion

H194.def: = marker indicating that the information that follows is possibly true but that there is no complete certainty

H3201.def: mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible

H3276.def: = process by which someone's well-being is promoted by a certain action or event

H6206.def: = process by which humans experience an extreme fear

H3811.def: = action by which humans spend all their forces on a certain activity

H5975.def: = process by which humans, deities, animals, or inanimate objects take position in a certain location in an upright position

H3467.def: = action by which humans or deities help themselves in a (difficult) situation

H1895.def: = action by which humans divide up a given object in their minds for purposes of research

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H2372.def: = process by which someone perceives an important object with the eyes, or witnesses an event of some significance

H3556.def: = celestial body, providing light, and assisting the sun and moon in ruling day and night; ◄ created and controled by the divine; ≈ associated with a high and elevated position and sometimes personified as creatures that can sing and wage war

H2320.def: = period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H7179.def: = dry grass-like remnant of wheat or another grain crop following the harvest; this term possibly refers to two kinds of material, one being the remnant of the crop remaining in the ground, the other being the unwanted residue of stalks; ► only used for brick making; ≈ usually considered of little value and needing to be separated from the grain itself; maybe burned

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H8313.def: = process by which an object is consumed by fire

H5337.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from a situation where it could be damaged

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H2552.def: = process by which human or inanimate objects feel or become warm or hot

H217.def: = fire; ► used for burning sacrifices and other objects, setting fire to arrows, and warming oneself; ≈ associated with light, warmth, and destruction

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H3021.def: = action by which humans are engaged in laborious activity which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion

glosses: to move about freely > to trade
H5503.def: = action of moving from place to place ► to carry out activities of commerce

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H3467.def: = action by which humans or deities help themselves in a (difficult) situation
